topic.title: Organizations
topic.p: Organizations provide top-level structuring of all entities in Qodana Cloud. Each organization is created on the basis of a specific JetBrains account, and becomes either public or private.
You can navigate between organizations using the list from the left sidebar of the Qodana Cloud UI.

chapter.title: Create an organization
chapter.p: You can create either private or public organizations. Private organizations are accessible only by their users. Reports of public organizations are available for all Qodana Cloud users, including unauthorized users with the viewer role.
Each organization can be created on the basis of an existing JetBrains account.

step.p: In the sidebar, expand the list of organizations and then click Create organization.

In the New organization dialog that opens, provide the organization name, and specify whether you would like to create this organization on the basis of an existing JetBrains account, or you need to create a new account for it. Finally, specify whether this organization will be public or private.

chapter.title: Configure organizations
chapter.p: You can configure membership and visibility of your organization, or leave the organization.

step.p: In the sidebar, navigate to the organization that you wish to configure.
On the organization page, click the Organization settings button in the upper-right corner.

chapter.p: On the settings page, you can find the following tabs:

list.li: Contributors contains the list of contributors to your organization
Logs contains the list of log entries related to your organization
Members contains the list of your organization members. Using this tab, you can manage your organization membership.

chapter.p: Clicking the button in the upper-right corner of the UI, you can switch the status of your organization, or completely leave it.
chapter.note: You cannot leave an organization in case you are the only member of it.

list.li: Invite new members using email addresses, and assign user roles
Change roles of existing organization members

step.p: On the settings page of the organization, navigate to the Members tab.
On the Members tab, click Invite members.
In the Invite members to ... organization dialog that opens, you can manage members of your organization.
